page.title: 09GARTMORE SHOP & CAMP SITES
page.content:
Mrs Walker owns the{shop.}There are 3 staff. The shop has a wide range of food and other things like postcards, sweets, meat, threads and needles and a small Post Office. The shop is about 150 years old. Vans come from Glasgow, Stirling and East Kilbride bringing in goods. This year the shop has been freshly painted and has Gartmore Rock, postcards and badges for the tourists.
There are 2{caravan sites}near Gartmore. Cobleland, owned by the Forestry Commission and Baad Springs Caravan site. Cobleland can accommodate 100 caravans at Â£3.80 per night. With one shop, showers and a washroom. Baad Springs can accommodate 64 caravans at Â£3.00 per night with one shop, toilets, playroom and playpark.
